title: Pune bridge tragedy: Rust, overcrowding or neglect - What caused the collapse?
content: A tragic bridge collapse in Pune's Maval tehsil, Maharashtra, injured many and left others missing. Preliminary reports suggest the old, rusted bridge gave way due to excessive crowding, despite being intended for pedestrian use only. Rescue operations are underway, and investigations are being conducted into the incident and lack of security.

title: Air India crash: Did electrical failure of B787 cause both engines to fail?
content: Speculations surrounding the AI 171 crash intensify, with a focus on potential electrical system failure in the Boeing 787, which uses electrical systems instead of conventional ones. Pilots are exploring if this contributed after a possible engine failure. While dual engine failures are rare, the 787's reliance on electrical systems prompts scrutiny.

title: ‘Students being relocated’: MEA on ensuring safety of Indians in Iran
content: Amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, India's MEA is closely monitoring the security situation, prioritizing the safety of its citizens. The Indian Embassy in Tehran is actively assisting students, relocating them to safer areas and maintaining contact with community leaders. Following airstrikes and missile exchanges, advisories have been issued, urging Indian nationals to remain vigilant and limit movement.

title: CM Siddaramaiah sandwiched as anti-caste survey agitation brews in Karnataka
content: Karnataka's Congress government faces a dilemma over a new caste survey, sparking discontent among OBCs who fear losing advantages from the un-implemented Kantharaj Commission report, which favored them. Lingayats and Vokkaligas, who opposed the previous report, are planning their own surveys. The government aims to complete the new survey in 90 days, following Congress leadership's directive.

title: How China dodges the US chip ban: Flying suitcases, renting servers abroad, and ....
content: Facing US restrictions on advanced AI chips, Chinese firms are innovating by processing data abroad. Engineers transported data to Malaysia, utilizing Nvidia chips in local data centers to train AI models. Southeast Asia is becoming a hub for these activities, testing the limits of regulatory oversight as data centers rapidly expand.

title: Bigger Indus plan: 113km canal to take surplus to Punjab, Haryana and Rajasthan
content: India is advancing its Indus water strategy by initiating a feasibility study for a 113 km canal to transfer surplus water from Jammu & Kashmir to Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan. This project aims to fully utilize the eastern rivers and India's allocated share in the western rivers, potentially reducing water flow to Pakistan.

title: 'Sometimes they have to fight it out': Trump says Iran-Israel will fight before peace
content: Amid escalating military strikes between Iran and Israel, US President Donald Trump urged both nations to negotiate a deal, acknowledging potential continued conflict beforehand. Recent clashes mark a dangerous escalation, with direct strikes replacing proxy warfare, raising concerns of a broader Middle East war. Trump hinted at behind-the-scenes efforts towards peace, expressing optimism for a future agreement.

title: World's second richest man: Jeff Bezos loses world’s No 2 spot; who's taken his place
content: Larry Ellison surpassed Jeff Bezos to become the world's second-richest person, driven by a $26 billion surge in his net worth following Oracle's strong earnings report. Ellison's total wealth reached $243 billion, exceeding Bezos' $227 billion and Zuckerberg's $239 billion. Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual with $407.3 billion.

title: Pakistan power players keep Imran jailed, shrink political space
content: Imran Khan's prolonged detention in Adiala Jail appears increasingly precarious due to escalating tensions with India, shifting international dynamics, and a domestic power nexus determined to keep him confined. The military's strengthened position and repaired relations with the US have further diminished prospects for his release. Facing numerous legal challenges and a fractured party, Khan's political future remains uncertain.

title: 'Housefull 5' BO collection: Akshay Kumar's film surpasses Rs 150 cr mark
content: Tarun Mansukhani's comedy 'Housefull 5,' starring Akshay Kumar, Abhishek Bachchan, and Riteish Deshmukh, continues its box office reign, crossing ₹150 crore in India within ten days. The film witnessed a significant boost during its second weekend, collecting ₹11 crore on Sunday, June 15, 2025. Its total collection stands at ₹153.

title: Airspace closures, Dreamliner checks trigger delays
content: Airspace closures following the Ahmedabad crash and enhanced Dreamliner checks are causing significant flight delays. Air India faces increased flying times and turnaround times, leading to cancellations. Dubai's air traffic control is overwhelmed, impacting various airlines, including SpiceJet, and leaving passengers stranded, with Dubai Airports issuing advisories about cancellations and delays.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai talks AI race; says leading company is like coaching Barcelona
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai addressed criticism about Google's AI progress after ChatGPT's launch and calls for his resignation. He stated he was aware of Google's internal AI developments, including bringing together Brain and DeepMind teams. Pichai emphasized his ability to ignore distractions and focus on important signals, comparing his role to coaching a major sports team.

title: E-Aadhaar: You’ll soon be able to do everything sitting at home, says UIDAI CEO
content: Soon, Indians can share Aadhaar electronically via a QR code-based app, eliminating the need for photocopies. UIDAI plans to accept documents like birth certificates and driving licenses for address updates, reducing fraud and the need to visit Aadhaar centers. CEO Bhuvnesh Kumar announced the new app, enabling most updates from home, excluding biometrics.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Not emergency contacts, most flyers had listed own numbers
content: Following the AI 171 crash, authorities faced significant hurdles in notifying families due to a lack of emergency contact information. In a staggering 70% of cases, the only number available was the passenger's, hindering immediate communication. This forced officials to rely on local administrators to locate and inform relatives, causing delays and complicating support efforts during a critical time.

title: Air India crash: Survivor tried to go back to save brother, says first responder
content: On June 12th at 1.40 pm, Satinder Singh Sandhu of EMRI 108 responded to a loud explosion near Civil Hospital. Arriving quickly, his team aided the injured hostel guard and Ramesh Viswashkumar, the sole survivor who was desperately searching for his brother amidst the chaos. The EMRI 108 team ensured Viswashkumar's safe transport to Civil Hospital.

title: Wayne Gretzky caught in backlash; Trump calls him ‘a free agent’; Canadians question his loyalty
content: Wayne Gretzky, a Canadian icon, faces backlash for his association with Donald Trump, particularly after Trump's remarks about Canada. Critics question Gretzky's Canadian identity, fueled by images of him at Trump events. Despite Gretzky's attempts to remain neutral, his silence on Trump's policies and his wife's social media activity have intensified the controversy, potentially impacting his legacy in Canada.

title: Farmers' stand-off near Manipur's ethnic buffer zone
content: Tensions flared in Manipur as Kuki and Meitei villagers clashed over ploughing rights near Sadu Lampak, along the Imphal East-Kangpokpi border. The dispute arose when a Meitei farmer attempted to cultivate land, leading to objections from Kuki villagers. Minor injuries were reported, and security forces intervened.

title: Uttarakhand chopper crash: No radar, no rules; inside Kedarnath's risky circuit
content: A surge in helicopter accidents, including two fatal crashes, has put Kedarnath's pilgrimage route under scrutiny. Pilots cite unpredictable weather, lack of air traffic control, and pressure to maintain flight schedules as major safety concerns.

title: Jammu and Kashmir: Pakistani infiltrators forced to retreat
content: Pakistani intruders were forced to retreat after Indian Army soldiers opened fire along the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu & Kashmir’s Rajouri district on Sunday. The incident triggered a brief exchange of fire. Security forces also observed suspicious movement along the LoC in the Poonch district, prompting a thorough combing operation.

title: Shah praise for CM Yogi on hiring record 60k constables 'sans bias'
content: Home Minister Amit Shah lauded Uttar Pradesh's record-breaking police recruitment drive, hiring over 60,000 constables, including a significant number of women. He emphasized the transparency of the selection process, highlighting merit-based appointments and the absence of bias, contrasting it with previous administrations.

title: ISS leaks 'small'; 'not uncommon' to delay launch: Nasa
content: Nasa and Axiom Space delayed the Axiom-4 mission due to leaks in the ISS's Russian module, now deemed "small." Roscosmos is working on repairs, with a possible launch date of June 19. SpaceX has resolved Falcon-9 rocket LOX leak issues. The mission, including India's Shubhanshu Shukla, will proceed once ISS repairs are confirmed.

title: Maharashtra bridge collapse: 4 dead, 51 injured after 'unfit' bridge falls near Pune
content: A structurally unsound footbridge over the Indrayani river, near Pune, collapsed on Sunday, resulting in four fatalities and 51 injuries. The incident occurred in Bhegdewadi, close to Kunda Mala, a popular tourist spot. Over 100 people were on the bridge when it gave way.

title: Air India crash: He flew to Ahmedabad to say hello to one son, goodbye to another
content: Ramesh Bhaliya arrived in Ahmedabad to claim his younger son Ajaykumar's remains after the AI 171 plane crash, while his elder son Viswash, the sole survivor, recovers in the hospital. The brothers, British citizens originally from Diu, were in India for business. Viswash, seated near the emergency exit, survived while Ajaykumar perished shortly after takeoff.

title: Air India plane crash: Bodies of 38 victims handed to kin; Rupani among those IDed
content: Following the Air India Flight 171 crash on June 12, authorities have identified and released the bodies of 38 victims to their families, including former Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani. DNA matching is ongoing to identify remaining victims, with 86 passengers and crew matched by Sunday evening.

title: New rules after 2022 crash still fall short of international norms: Experts
content: Kedarnath's helicopter operations, vital for the yatra, face high risks due to the absence of air traffic control, radar coverage, and real-time weather monitoring. Pilots navigate the challenging air corridor relying on visual cues, raising safety concerns. Despite past accidents and proposed safety measures, critical infrastructure gaps persist, leaving flights vulnerable to unpredictable weather conditions.

title: Taylor Swift’s alleged falling out with Blake Lively gets deeper
content: A shocking rift has reportedly emerged between Taylor Swift and Blake Lively, sending shockwaves through Hollywood. Sources suggest a deeply personal issue caused the fracture, impacting Swift's inner circle. Fans noticed Lively's absence from recent events, fueling speculation further. Lyrics from Swift's song 'Bejeweled' are now being interpreted as clues about the fallout.

title: PM Modi: 3-nation tour chance to thank partners for backing India's fight against terror
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's three-nation tour, commencing with Cyprus, aims to express gratitude for international support in combating cross-border terrorism. He seeks to bolster global cooperation against all forms of terrorism. The visit includes participation in the G7 outreach session and bilateral meetings where Pakistan's role in supporting terrorism will likely be addressed.

title: Toddler among 7 killed as Kedarnath chopper crashes amid bad weather
content: A helicopter crash near Gaurikund on the Kedarnath route claimed seven lives, including a toddler and the pilot. The Aryan Aviation's Bell 407 chopper, carrying pilgrims, crashed and caught fire amid adverse weather conditions. Preliminary reports suggest dense clouds and heavy rain, indicated by a yellow alert, may have contributed to the accident.

title: Jammu and Kashmir: Parents of students in Iran demand evacuation
content: Amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, worried parents in Srinagar are urgently appealing for the evacuation of their children studying in Iranian universities. With over 1,300 Indian students reportedly stranded, Chief Minister Omar Abdullah assures close monitoring and coordination with the Ministry of External Affairs.

title: Jammu and Kashmir: Raids in Poonch to bust terror links
content: Jammu and Kashmir police conducted raids at eight locations in Poonch, targeting individuals associated with Pakistan-based terrorists. The operation aimed to dismantle terror infrastructure and thwart attempts to incite subversive activities among local youth. These raids are part of ongoing efforts to tighten security, disrupt cross-border connections, and prevent the resurgence of militancy in the region.

title: Father's Day: Yuvraj pays emotional tribute to Yograj - ‘One who taught me …’
content: On Father's Day, Yuvraj Singh paid tribute to his father, Yograj Singh, acknowledging his pivotal role in shaping his resilience and fighting spirit. Yuvraj credited his father's strict, yet defining, discipline for instilling the values of hard work and mental fortitude that propelled his successful cricket career. Yograj's influence extended to Yuvraj's inspiring comeback after battling cancer.

title: Opening up space & nuclear sectors most unexpected decisions of Modi govt: Minister
content: Space Minister Jitendra Singh highlighted PM Modi's unexpected reforms, including opening the space and nuclear sectors to private investment. This shift, driven by the need to augment government resources, has spurred phenomenal growth in the space economy, now valued at $8 billion and projected to reach $45 billion in the next decade.

title: Iran under fire: Israel bombs Mashhad airport; calls it longest-range strike yet - video
content: Israel has confirmed conducting an airstrike on Mashhad airport in Iran, targeting a military refuelling aircraft in what it claims was its longest-range strike. Iranian media reported explosions and fires in Mashhad, activating air defenses. The Israeli Chief of Staff stated the Air Force is attacking Iran’s infrastructure extensively, aiming to remove an existential threat.

title: Tom Brady’s loss? Gisele Bündchen says she’s finally earned her happiness without him
content: Gisele Bundchen is in a new phase after her divorce from Tom Brady. She welcomed a baby boy with Joaquim Valente. Gisele feels content with her expanded family. She is a mother to Benjamin, Vivian, and considers Jack her bonus child. She spoke about healing from her divorce. Gisele focuses on her children and personal well-being.

title: IND vs ENG: Spin to win? Kuldeep Yadav sees encouraging signs for spinners
content: Kuldeep Yadav anticipates favorable conditions for spinners during India's upcoming Test series in England, observing encouraging signs in the ongoing practice match. With Ashwin's retirement, Kuldeep aims to support Jadeja, focusing on building synergy and bowling volume to adapt to the longer format. He also lauded Shubman Gill's leadership, highlighting his focus on team spirit.

title: Trump at 79: Tanks, protests & the Middle East; Inside US prez’s most volatile week
content: Donald Trump's 79th birthday was marked by a controversial military parade amidst escalating domestic unrest and a spiraling Middle East conflict. The week saw unprecedented actions, including the deployment of federal troops to quell protests and a senator's arrest, sparking widespread condemnation.

title: India's intrasquad match: Shardul slams 122 not out; all you need to know
content: Shardul Thakur's impressive, unbeaten 122 off 68 balls in the intra-squad match against India A has strengthened his case for inclusion in the first Test against England. Sarfaraz Khan also scored a century. Watched by chief selector Ajit Agarkar and VVS Laxman, Thakur's performance gives him an edge over Nitish Kumar Reddy.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: Trump vetoed Khamenei hit, claims report
content: Amid escalating tensions, former President Trump reportedly blocked an Israeli plan to assassinate Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei. According to U.S. officials, Trump intervened, stating the U.S. wouldn't target Iranian leadership without an American casualty. This decision comes as Israel claims responsibility for attacks under 'Operation Rising Lion,' while Iran retaliates with missile barrages.

title: Gold for India! Hillang Yajik shines; internet goes crazy
content: Hillang Yajik from Arunachal Pradesh made history by winning a gold medal in the Women's Model Physique category at the 15th South Asian Bodybuilding and Physique Sports Championships 2025 in Bhutan. She also secured a silver medal. Yajik is the first woman athlete from Arunachal Pradesh to achieve this feat in an international physique sports tournament.

title: AI and biomanufacturing: can India’s policies match its ambitions?
content: When an AI model is used to control a bioreactor, how do we know it’s reliable? Who checks that the data it was trained on is representative of India’s diverse conditions, or that it won’t make a catastrophic error if something unexpected happens? These aren’t just technical questions. They are matters of public trust and safety

title: CPI (Maoist) condemns Operation Kagar, calls for bandh in TG, A.P. on June 20
content: CPI (Maoist) calls for bandh in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh on June 20 against Operation Kagar killings

title: FLO’s rural skill centre to empower women opened in Bhongir
content: The objective behind setting up of the centre is to transform lives of rural women by equipping them with employable skills and entrepreneurial capabilities

title: State govt.’s intervention sought to ensure better facilities at Beypore harbour
content: Demand for a government-run boat maintenance yard continues to be ignored, forcing many operators to rely on costly private services, allege action committee members

title: Chennai-bound British Airways flight returns to London after ‘technical snag’
content: The flight was operated by a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner aircraft; a Frankfurt-Hyderabad flight also returned to base after a bomb threat

title: Mananchira–Vellimadukunnu Road work to begin today amid row over second stretch
content: CPI(M) claims Ministry of Road Transport and Highways yet to permit govt. to proceed with work on Malaparamba–Vellimadukunnu stretch

title: Mortal remains of former Gujarat CM Rupani, over 40 victims identified through DNA profiling; Air India contacts relatives of all victims
content: Gujarat Health Minister Rushikesh Patel says funeral of the former Chief Minister will be held at Rajkot on Monday with full State honours; 24 bodies already handed over to grieving families

title: Wayanad records high rainfall between June 2024 and May 2025, says Hume Centre
content: By analysing data from all stations, it was found that the district received an average rainfall of nearly 4,000 mm during this period, says the centre

title: Sonia Gandhi hospitalised for stomach-related issues in Delhi
content: Sonia Gandhi admitted to hospital for stomach-related issues, stable condition under doctor’s observation

title: BJP ally Tipra Motha seeks PM's intervention for 'pushing back' illegal immigrants in Tripura
content: A 15-member delegation of the TMP, led by Animesh Debbarma, met Governor N. Indrasena Reddy on Saturday and handed over a memorandum

title: NIA files chargesheet against three accused in Punjab grenade attack case linked to Khalistan Zindabad Force
content: The NIA has invoked various provisions of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act and the Explosive Substances Act

title: Israel-Iran tension: Kashmiri students in Iran feel ‘traumatised’, parents seek PM’s intervention
content: J&K CM Omar Abdullah said he was in touch with the Ministry of External Affairs regarding the evolving situation in Iran with regard to Kashmiri students in Tehran, Shiraz, Qom, and other Iranian cities

title: IndiGo Airbus A320 aircraft tail scrapes runway, industry sources say; airline denies ‘tail strike’ report
content: IndiGo acknowledges an incident occurred, but refuses to characterise it as a tail strike; there have been six such incidents by IndiGo A321s since 2023; AAIB yet to release report on its probe into tail strikes

title: Air India Ahmedabad plane crash: International agencies reach Ahmedabad to assist in crash probe
content: Downloading and analysing black box could take four to five days; personnel from U.S. and U.K. arrive in Ahmedabad; UN norms state that a country probing an accident should produce a preliminary report within 30 days

title: Raj Bhavan and the ruling NC in Kashmir spar over offer of jobs to family of local Pahalgam terror victim
content: The L-G’s office said the appointment was made by exercising discretionary powers vested with it, the NC said the job order had already been prepared by the J&K Fisheries Department

title: Awards from government deserve special respect, says Dil Raju
content: The Chairman of the Film Development Corporation and film producer was not happy on top stars skipping the film awards

title: AISF demands criminal action against FIITJEE for downing shutters without notice
content: AISF State vice president alleges that the institute collected huge amounts towards fees a year in advance from students; however claiming losses, they have been shutting down centres one after another

title: India must stand with international law and UN charter: Ukraine Minister
content: Ahead of possible Modi-Zelenskyy meeting at G-7 in Canada, Minister says Ukraine will welcome any Indian move to facilitate talks with Russia

title: Red Sox deal All-Star Devers to Giants in stunner
content: The Giants are sending Jordan Hicks, Kyle Harrison, outfield prospect James Tibbs III and pitching prospect Jose Bello to the Red Sox for Rafael Devers.

title: Spaun captures first major title, wins U.S. Open
content: J.J. Spaun, 34, who started Sunday one stroke behind 54-hole leader Sam Burns, survived a terrible start and challenging elements to pull away from the pack and capture his first major title with a two-stroke win in the U.S. Open at Oakmont Country Club.

title: Grizzlies send Bane to Magic in blockbuster trade
content: The Grizzlies traded Desmond Bane to the Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, Cole Anthony, four unprotected first-round picks and one first-round pick swap.

title: USMNT ends skid, nets 5 in Gold Cup opening win
content: Malik Tillman scored twice as the United States built a three-goal, first-half lead and ended a four-game losing streak by routing Trinidad and Tobago 5-0 on Sunday in a Concacaf Gold Cup opener.

title: Sky's Reese 2nd youngest to record triple-double
content: Angel Reese had 11 points, 11 assists and 13 rebounds for her first career triple-double in the Sky's 78-66 win over the Sun on Sunday.

title: Judge 1-for-12 as NY swept: Got to swing at strikes
content: Aaron Judge blamed himself for swinging at pitches outside the strike zone as the Yankees were swept in a three-game series at the Red Sox.

title: Braves lose, waste Holmes' 15-strikeout effort
content: Atlanta starter Grant Holmes pitched five hitless innings and ended with a career-best 15 strikeouts on Sunday afternoon, but the Braves faltered in the end, dropping a 10-1 decision to the Colorado Rockies, a loss that dropped them to 31-39 this season.

title: Louisville's late rally knocks Arizona out of MCWS
content: Zion Rose's two-run single gave Louisville its first lead during a six-run eighth as the Cardinals ousted Arizona from the Men's College World Series.

title: ✍  Deals NBA stars should get this summer
content: A $125 million deal for Giddey? Who could give $80 million to Kuminga? See what our resident GM is offering 10 star free agents.

title: Grading the Desmond Bane trade between the Magic and Grizzlies
content: The NBA offseason is almost here, and deals are already underway. Catch up on the latest trade grades.

title: Malik Tillman shines as USMNT secures a much-needed win
content: Malik Tillman was the USMNT's best as Mauricio Pochettino’s team bounced back from a rough week to open its Gold Cup with a 5-0 victory.

title: George Russell wins in Canada as McLarens crash
content: George Russell won a Canadian Grand Prix that exploded into drama when Lando Norris collided with title rival and teammate Oscar Piastri.

title: Shane van Gisbergen wins Cup race at Mexico City
content: Shane van Gisbergen once again mastered a new track to win NASCAR's first Cup Series points-paying race outside the United States in the modern era.

title: Panthers within one win of a Cup repeat: Grades for both teams, outlook for Game 6
content: Florida leads Edmonton 3-2 heading home for the next game. Here's how it happened, and what to watch for.

title: Bayern Munich's ruthless win in Club World Cup sets new FIFA record
content: Bayern Munich clobbered an amateur team in the Club World Cup, setting a new all-time record in FIFA competitions.

title: Poch: Pulisic can't dictate which games he plays
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said he wouldn't allow Christian Pulisic to dictate which games he would be available for.

title: Musiala nets hat trick, Bayern hit 10 to start CWC
content: Bayern Munich began their Club World Cup campaign in emphatic fashion with a ruthless 10-0 demolition of Auckland City on Sunday, as Jamal Musiala marked his return from injury with a brilliant second-half hat trick in a commanding team display.

title: Italy great Gattuso named country's new coach
content: Former midfield great Gennaro Gattuso has been appointed as Italy's new head coach following Luciano Spalletti exit from the national team.

title: Angel City wear shirts supporting 'immigrant city'
content: Angel City, the NWSL team based in Los Angeles, distributed T-shirts to fans on Saturday that proclaimed "Immigrant City Football Club."

title: Cherki eyes Ballon d'Or after Man City transfer
content: Rayan Cherki has said he is hoping that Manchester City can provide the platform to win the Ballon d'Or following his move from Lyon.

title: PSG inspired by SoFi as new stadium hunt begins
content: PSG are drawing inspiration from new state-of-the-art venues in Los Angeles as they process of building a new stadium for the team, the club's CEO said.

title: Messi denied late as Miami draws CWC opener
content: Lionel Messi and Inter Miami were held to a scoreless draw against Egypt's Al Ahly in the opening game of the Club World Cup on Saturday night.

title: Tel joins Spurs in permanent deal after loan
content: Tottenham Hotspur have signed Mathys Tel on a permanent transfer from Bayern Munich, the Premier League club has announced.

title: Texas State, cryptic posts and the Pac-12's next move
content: Texas State looms as the favorite to join the Pac-12. Why could that happen? What would come next? And what about Memphis?

title: Carlota Ciganda takes LPGA Classic; first win in eight years
content: Carlota Ciganda birdied the final two holes to win the Meijer LPGA Classic on Sunday for her first LPGA Tour victory in more than 8 1/2 years.

title: An 11-year NBA veteran and the emergency transplant that saved his life
content: Sixteen months ago, Scot Pollard was in active heart failure, about to die. Then came a lifesaving transplant, uniting two families -- and two fathers -- forever. Watch E60's "Heart of Pearl" at 1 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: The NBA draft's best at 20 different traits, skills: Where Flagg, Bailey and Fears stand out
content: Best clutch player? Top on-ball defender? Elite court vision? We hand out superlatives for this year's class.

title: How Aaliyah Chavez and her dad bonded through basketball
content: With Father's Day here, the OU signee and her dad reflect on a relationship forged through tough practices together -- a bond that might not have otherwise existed.

title: Cam Ward gives thanks to dad, who drove him all over Texas to help him reach his dreams
content: Tennessee's No. 1 pick credits his dad for emailing coaches and driving him all over Texas just to get him a chance.

title: 'I know he's proud': Brian Schottenheimer leans on life lessons from dad, Marty
content: Dallas' coach spoke of the bond ahead of Father's Day as he follows in the footsteps of Marty, who died in 2021.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye a trio of targets from top clubs
content: Real Madrid eye a trio of targets, including Liverpool's Ibrahima Konate. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: How should the Blues trim their squad before next season?
content: Fresh off winning the UEFA Europa Conference League and finishing in the top four, what must manager Enzo Maresca & Co. do this offseason to prepare and refine their squad?

title: India-origin man dies days after Australian police allegedly knelt on his neck
content: Gaurav Kundi was rushed to a hospital after his condition declined, and he ‘became unresponsive’ during the attempted arrest

title: One dead after landslip hits Kedarnath walking route, yatra suspended from Sonpryag till further orders
content: Citing safety concerns amid the adverse weather, the Rudrapryag Police appealed to the devotees coming to Kedarnath temple to remain safe wherever they are

title: ‘Beef’ near temple in Goalpara district now, five arrested
content: Lakhipur town has been tense since the body part of a cow was found near a Kali temple on Saturday night

title: Lufthansa flight to Hyderabad returns to Frankfurt following bomb threat
content: The aircraft had been scheduled to arrive at Hyderabad’s Rajiv Gandhi International Airport (RGIA) at approximately 1.20 a.m. on Monday, June 16

title: I can never step onto a plane, says teen who became key witness after recording Air India flight crash in Ahmedabad
content: The 17-year-old had arrived in Ahmedabad just an hour back and had shot the video to show his friends back in village

title: Gas leak continues at Assam ONGC well after three days of blowout, 70 families shifted
content: An official said ‘the well killing process’ is going on and a crisis management team is working on war-footing to control the leakage

title: World Crocodile Day: Odisha’s pioneering efforts have made it a leader in crocodile conservation
content: Odisha is the only State to host the wild populations of all three native species — gharial, saltwater crocodile and mugger

title: Priyanka accuses LDF govt. of politicising welfare pension payment
content: At a roadshow in support of the United Democratic Front candidate in the Nilambur byelection, Ms. Vadra says lives and livelihoods of people should not be subject to political manipulations

title: Three West Bengal residents pushed into Bangladesh by BSF, return after State govt.’s intervention
content: Trinamool Congress MP Samirul Islam says that when the workers were picked up by the police in Mumbai, all necessary documents were provided by the State government

title: Karnataka tops country in wind power capacity addition in 2024 – 25
content: The State’s installed wind power capacity is now more than the combined capacity of countries like South Africa, Portugal, and New Zealand

title: MEA must move beyond passive advisories, establish coordinated evacuation for Indian students in Iran: Congress
content: While Indian students in Iran are calling for help, the government remains largely unresponsive even as missiles rain from the sky, Congress leader Pawan Khera alleges

title: 98.52% secure Plus One allotment in main phase
content: A total of 3.12 lakh students have got allotment till now; 87,928 students got fresh allotment in third list alone

title: Census notification to be issued on June 16: Ministry of Home Affairs
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah reviews preparations for the two-phase exercise which will conclude by March 1, 2027

title: Tamil Nadu government notifies law to prevent coercive recovery of micro-loans
content: The Act is aimed at protecting the weaker and vulnerable groups and individuals from the coercive methods of recovering loans by money-lending entities such as micro-finance institutions and money-lending agencies operating in the State

title: Rain relentless in Kerala, holiday declared for educational institutions in nine districts on Monday
content: Kasaragod, Kannur, Kozhikode, Wayanad, and Malappuram on red alert on Monday. Mining operations banned in Kottayam till June 17

title: HRD Minister Lokesh congratulates NEET-UG rankers from Andhra Pradesh
content: The students have made us proud by achieving outstanding ranks through their talent and hard work, he says in a post on X

title: ‘Pursuit of Happiness,’ a path towards higher education for students in Idukki
content: Through the project, the district administration aims to provide financial assistance to students who are in need

title: Government’s decision to increase working hours opposed
content: APSRTC Staff and Workers Federation leaders express concern over the government’s “anti-worker policies” and say that they will participate in a State-wide protest on June 19

title: Seminar highlights impact of citizen science in bird watching
content: Kerala Bird Monitoring Collective, which is organisinf the event along with Kerala Agricultural University, is celebrating a decade of impactful citizen science in bird observation and conservation

title: Order on ceasing bike taxi operations to come into effect from June 16
content: A Division Bench of the High Court, on June 13, upheld a single judge order dated April 2, which had directed all bike taxi services to wind up operations within six weeks

title: Ponguleti for humanitarian approach towards farmers’ problems
content: Minister directs officials to resolve grievances submitted during Revenue Sadassus as fast as possible; reviews the survey and mapping of five villages uncovered for decades

title: There is no question of change in leadership in State, says Mahadevappa
content: We do not know when the Congress high command discussed the issue with Vishwanath, according to the Minister

title: India will continue its efforts to strengthen its ties with Cyprus in the future: Prime Minister Modi
content: The Cypriot President said it is a “historic visit” and a “new chapter in a strategic partnership that knows no limits”

title: Ambedkar row: Bihar State Commission for Scheduled Castes serves notice to Lalu Prasad
content: The Commission asked the RJD leader to provide an explanation within 15 days or else a case would be registered against him under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act

title: Senate members seek clarity on picking minor courses for FYUGP in Calicut varsity
content: Senate members urged VC to allow students to choose minor courses aligned with major subjects to avoid forcing them into areas they are not interested in

title: Iran Rejects Truce Talks As Israel Pounds Tehran, Sirens Heard In Tel Aviv: 10 Points
content: The fighting between Israel and Iran intensified overnight, as both nations kept up their attacks, killing civilians and raising concern among world leaders that the biggest battle between old enemies could lead to a broad regional conflict.

title: Trump Administration Weighs Adding 36 Countries To Travel Ban, Memo Says
content: US President Donald Trump's administration is considering significantly expanding its travel ban by potentially banning citizens of 36 additional countries from entering the United States, according to an internal State Department cable.

title: Updates: Ex Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani's Funeral With Full State Honours Today
content: Former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani was on the Air India flight 171, belonging to Boeing Dreamliner 787-8 fleet, which crashed on Thursday afternoon within seconds after take-off.

title: Britain Appoints Blaise Metreweli As First Female Head Of MI6 Spy Agency
content: Britain on Sunday named Blaise Metreweli, a career intelligence officer, as the first female head of the Secret Intelligence Service, the foreign spy service known as MI6.

title: Filmmaker Missing Since Air India Plane Crash, Wife Fears He May Be Ground Victim
content: The family of a filmmaker have submitted DNA samples after he went missing on Thursday and his mobile phone location was last traced to just 700 metres away from the horrific Air India plane crash.

title: Indian Students In Iran Being Moved To Safer Places As Conflict Deepens
content: Indian students in Iran being moved to safer places within the country, says New Delhi as Middle East conflict intensifies

title: Amit Shah Reviews Preparations For Census, Official Notification Today
content: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday reviewed the preparation for the forthcoming census with Union Home Secretary Govind Mohan and other senior officials here.

title: Israel, Iran Continue To Trade Missile Attacks, Sirens Heard In Jerusalem
content: Israeli skies were streaked with a barrage of Iranian missiles yet again on Sunday amid a spiralling conflict between the two nations.

title: BJP Demands Congress Apologise Over "Fake News" On Pak Army Chief
content: The Congress claims that the US had invited Pakistan's army chief General Asim Munir for a military parade hosted by President Donald Trump has landed the party in a huge controversy

title: 'Had Fever, Wife Said Don't Go': Gujarat Doctor Who Cancelled Air India Ticket
content: A doctor from Gujarat cannot stop thanking his wife and family members after he cancelled an Air India flight in which he planned to fly to London on June 12.

title: Israel-Iran Attack LIVE: Sirens, Booms Heard In Jerusalem, Air Defence Activated In Tehran
content: Israel-Iran Attack Live: Israel and Iran exchanged attacks for the third day, with the Israeli military saying it conducted an "extensive series of strikes" on the headquarters of the Iranian Defence Ministry and the SPND nuclear project.

title: "Structure Shook For 5 Minutes": Witnesses Recount Pune Bridge Collapse
content: Four tourists have died and 39 have been rescued after an iron bridge over the Indrayani river near Pune collapsed.

title: Pune Bridge Collapse Highlights:  Rs 5 Lakh Aid For Families Of Those Killed In Bridge Collapse Near Pune
content: Four people were killed after a bridge on a river near Pune collapsed on Sunday afternoon. Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has announced financial aid for families of those killed in the bridge collapse.

title: Trump Vetoed Israeli Plan To Kill Iran's Supreme Leader: US Officials
content: President Donald Trump vetoed an Israeli plan in recent days to kill the Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, two US officials said.

title: Sonia Gandhi Admitted To Delhi's Ganga Ram Hospital
content: Sonia Gandhi was admitted to the Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in the national capital due to stomach-related issues, the premier hospital confirmed.

title: Manipur BJP Spokesperson Writes To PM, Asks Not To Renew Controversial Deal With Insurgents
content: A BJP spokesperson from the Thadou tribe in Manipur has requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi to consider the Manipur assembly's unanimous resolution in February 2024 that called for not extending the controversial suspension of operations.

title: Can A Bee Sting Cause Heart Attack? What Doctor Said
content: Dr Ashish Agrawal, Director of Cardiology at Aakash Healthcare, said bee stings can cause a severe allergic reaction known as anaphylaxis.

title: Air India Plane Crash: High-Level Committee Set Up By Government To Meet Tomorrow
content: The first meeting of the high-level multi-disciplinary committee set up by the government to look into the Ahmedabad plane crash will be held on Monday here, sources said.

title: "Iran, Israel Should Make Deal Just Like I Got India, Pak To Make One": Trump
content: US President Donald Trump claimed that he could secure a deal between Iran and Israel just as he had done between India and Pakistan last month by "using trade".

title: Indian Students Stranded In Tehran, J&K Parents Hold Protest, Appeal To PM
content: More than 1,500 Indian students, most of them from Jammu and Kashmir, have got stranded in Iran amid the escalating regional conflict.
